title: Freedmen's Bureau Records: John W. Jordan to Orlando Brown, May 31, 1868
summary: Jordan's monthly report is largely positive and optimistic about the state of affairs in Augusta County. He does, however, observe that while white farmers seem to possess "kind" feelings towards freedmen, townspeople possess an "intense hostility" toward the exercise of civil and political rights on the part of blacks.
keywords: Church/Religious Activity, Education, Employment/Labor, Community Values/Local Behavior, Politics/Political Attitudes, Race Relations, Violence/Crime, American Civil War
